title: Did BLACKPINK surpass the success or the popularity of BTS? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m going to answer this question from a different perspective, and rephrase the question a bit. “[Have] Blackpink surpass[ed] the success [and] popularity of BTS [at this stage of their career]?” There. That’s a better question. You want the answer straight up? Yes.  Before you tell me that BTS have done this and done that so I can't compare the two, hear me out. I’m going to highlight something really important. “At this stage of their career”. I added this because I feel it’s important to be unbiased, and only by comparing groups at a similar stage of their careers can we hope to evaluate them on more objective terms. Blackpink has just entered the third year of their careers. At this stage, Blackpink is (and you can fight me on this) the most well-known girl group globally. They have racked up millions of views, and have a strong fanbase all over the world. Additionally, they have toured in America and performed at Coachella; they have charted globally and are pretty much a household name for K-pop. They are successful and popular. They are definitely more successful and popular than BTS were in the third year or their careers. In 2016, BTS hadn't made it globally, but were well on their way to establishing themselves as the face of the industry for years to come. They had hits, sure; but they were in no way as successful or as popular as Blackpink are in their third year. This method of analysis can be flawed, because there are so many factors which contribute to differences in success and popularity which I have purposefully not included, for the sake of simplicity. I have ignored all the other factors such as the prevalence of K-pop in the world at the time and the company with which the group debuted, to name a couple. Because I don't think all of these factors answer the question. The question was “Have they surpass[ed] the success and popularity of BTS?” If we’re talking about them in 2019, then NO. Today, BTS and Blackpink are worlds apart. BTS is definitely more successful and popular. But at the same stage of their careers, Blackpink wins. Every. Single. Time. Please don't attack me in the comments for me saying this, because it is true. BTS in 2016 was not as successful OR as popular as Blackpink in 2019. Period. However, BTS in 2019 definitely beats out Blackpink in 2019. Period. Hope that answers your question.  EDIT: I have highlighted in bold the points which I urge you to read before you comment. I am not trying to say that BTS is not as good as Blackpink. What I am trying to do is answer the question. BTS and Blackpink now should not be compared, but BTS in 2016 is not as successful and popular as Blackpink are in 2019. If you want to tell me all the reasons why Blackpink are bad, feel free to do so, but do not that your comments do not contribute to the answering of the question posed. The questions was “who is more successful and popular” and doesn't include a ‘why”. If there was a “why”, I wouldn't have answered this question, because then my answer would be biased, due to the fact that most of the points I would have raised would have been heavily opinionated and influenced by my own experiences in K-pop.

This is not meant to be mean, I love both groups so much, but in no way has Blackpink surpassed the popularity of BTS. Blackpink in my eyes are still a rookie group. They have under 10 songs out, they have ok vocals and dance but have in no way contributed to their music or style. Even MCs still treat Blackpink like they are rookies. I think they are so sweet, but are a perfect example of a group from the Big 3. With Blackpink, YG has created an image for them. They don’t produce any of their own songs and are somewhat cookie cutter like. Their style isn't original and they don’t really switch it up. With BTS it’s the opposite way around. No one had heard of Bighit entertainment before BTS (they might have but not as it now). BTS are artists who contribute to their songs and have made a name for themselves WORLDWIDE, which is something even popular western artist struggle to do. Blackpink’s views and likes on social media are impressive, but at the end of the day that only goes so far. The reality is that they can't sell out stadiums or stay on the top of the charts with such limited material. Right now, no one in kpop can compete with BTS on the level of success they have achieved.

I don’t think so. Blackpink has a lot of views on their songs. But when you look at the MAMA rankings:       Blackpink isn’t topping anything, while BTS is topping everything they have been nominated for. They are also the male group with the most votes and when you look at the % is in between 37.99% and 44.40% which is more then a third of the votes. And when you look at the MMA’S:  You see that BTS has won 6 awards and Blackpink 1 and they are both in the Top 10 Artists. BTS has around 191 songs while Blackpink has 9 and doesn’t have a full album yet. Blackpink has only debuted in 2016 with a year hiatus while BTS debuted in 2013. BTS has more experience then Blackpink so I don’t think Blackpink has surpassed. Please compare this: List of awards and nominations received by Blackpink - Wikipedia To this: List of awards and nominations received by BTS - Wikipedia I don’t think any of the groups are untalented.

Well this question in itself is very rhetorical because the answer to this question is quite evident. Even though blackpink members are talented and have high popularity but are nowhere near BTS. But comparing BLACKPINK with BTS will also be wrong because, Blackpink is a rookie group and have lot to learn and still don’t have enough songs to claim their undying popularity and claim to surpass BTS because that will be delusional. BTS’ global phenomenon does not need any introduction and quite honestly is incomparable. BTS have proven time and again of their global status and sales and charting power with constantly self producing content that have made people across globe to invest their time in them. Well BTS has successfully made it in the western market and have received global acceptance which no other artist in Korea or Asia has been able to do which is a huge success. Being said that BLACKPINK should learn, practice and rehearse more in order to achieve greater success, not to compete with BTS but for their own achievement.

My Answer: October 23, 2018 That answer is unknown to me. I do not follow BLACK PINK as much as I do BTS. I am a fan of them and I enjoy their music but I tend to stay more where BTS is since I have known them longer. And I think my answer would be no. But I don’t know what they have going on. PS: Thanks for reading sorry it wasn’t too much but hope this helped.
blackpink cant surpass twice in album sales so that means they havent surpassed bts lmao
